video.title: The Great Gatsby Bootcamp - Full Gatsby.js Tutorial Course
video.description:
Gatsby is a framework for creating blazing fast websites and web applications. Powered by React and GraphQL, Gatsby gives you everything you need to build and launch your next project. In this tutorial, you will learn everything you need to build and launch your first site with Gatsby. You’ll build a website from scratch and learn how to get it deployed to production.

💻 Course created by Andrew Mead. Follow him on Twitter: https://twitter.com/andrew_j_mead

Andrew Mead's premium courses:
🔗 Node.js (most popular): http://links.mead.io/fccnode
🔗 JavaScript: http://links.mead.io/fccjs
🔗 React: http://links.mead.io/fccreact
🔗 GraphQL: http://links.mead.io/fccgraphql

replies.author: Brad Bodine
replies.text: This will lock the version to a specific number so that if the package is updated you won't get a different result that what is shown in the video. He did not lock the version when he installed the env-cmd package and a few days after the video was created, the package maintainer pushed an update that requires the -f flag before calling the file name. Lot's of people are having issues with that part of the tutorial now but if the version was locked in the video,,, it would have prevented this.

replies.author: Peter Frescura
replies.text: Andrew does this, in his courses too, so that anyone who is actively coding along will have the same package versions as he is using.
